alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Gilmer; Lewis (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:25AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Gilmer, southern Lewis and northern Braxton Counties through 300 AM EDT... At 224 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cedar Creek State Park, or 8 miles south of Glenville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cedar Creek State Park, Burnsville, Flatwoods, Sand Fork, Shock, Rosedale, Stouts Mills, Sand Run, Exchange, Heaters, Walkersville, Ireland, Cedarville, Normantown and Falls Mills. This includes Interstate 79 between mile markers 67 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
